verses.name: Proverbs 14:12
verses.text: There is a way which seemeth right unto a man, but the end thereof are the ways of death.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:13
verses.text: Even in laughter the heart is sorrowful; and the end of that mirth is heaviness.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:14
verses.text: The backslider in heart shall be filled with his own ways: and a good man shall be satisfied from himself.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:15
verses.text: The simple believeth every word: but the prudent man looketh well to his going.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:16
verses.text: A wise man feareth, and departeth from evil: but the fool rageth, and is confident.

verses.name: Proverbs 14:17
verses.text: He that is soon angry dealeth foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
